original: rdo rje'i tshig 'di ci yi slad du gsungs //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig 'di ci yi slad du gsungs //
translated: Why did you speak these vajra words?

original: zhes bya ba la ci'i slad du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni zlog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ci'i slad du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni zlog ste /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúwhy‚Äù is reversed.

original: byis pa rnams skrag par bgyid lags pas gsung 'di lta bu 'dis stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar ba'i sgo'i ngo bo'i chos nyid bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: byis pa rnams skrag par bgyid lags pas gsung 'di lta bu 'dis stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar ba'i sgo'i ngo bo'i chos nyid bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that because they frighten the childish, you should not teach the reality that is the nature of the doors of liberation such as emptiness by means of such statements.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khams gsum las 'das shing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khams gsum las 'das shing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúHaving transcended the three realms.‚Äù

original: khams gsum po dag las 'das par gyur pa'o //üîΩ'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las 'das pas zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gcig las 'das pa nyid 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: khams gsum po dag las 'das par gyur pa'o // 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las 'das pas zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gcig las 'das pa nyid 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las 'das pa yin te /
translated: They have gone beyond the three realms.üîΩ‚ÄúHaving transcended all world systems‚Äù means that having gone beyond just one of the three realms, they have gone beyond all world systems.

original: khams gsum gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the reality of just one of the three realms is the reality of all world systems.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig gi lam rdo rje'i tshig ces bya ba la yang dag pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig gi lam rdo rje'i tshig ces bya ba la yang dag pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúvajra words‚Äù are the path of the unreal.

original: bden pa ma yin pas yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa ma yin pas yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The unreal is not real.

original: de ston pa'i tshig ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de ston pa'i tshig ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words that teach that are the words of the unreal.

original: de'i lam ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo bzhi'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i lam ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo bzhi'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The path of that is the nature of the four doors of liberation.

original: de nyid rdo rje'i tshig ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi bsgoms pa las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'grub pas na /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje'i tshig ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi bsgoms pa las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'grub pas na /
translated: Those are the vajra words, because all the TathƒÅgatas are accomplished through the cultivation of the four doors of liberation.

original: de nyid gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rdo rje'i tshig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rdo rje'i tshig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because of that, they are the vajra words.üîΩ‚ÄúSon of noble family, do not generate such a notion of inferiority and such a notion of contempt!‚Äù

original: rigs kyi bu dman pa'i 'du shes dang smad pa'i 'du shes 'di lta bu ma skyed cig / ces bya ba ni skye ba med par bstan pas byis pa thams cad skrag par byed pa ste de'i phyir dman pa yin pas dman pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dman pa'i 'du shes dang smad pa'i 'du shes 'di lta bu ma skyed cig / ces bya ba ni skye ba med par bstan pas byis pa thams cad skrag par byed pa ste de'i phyir dman pa yin pas dman pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: This is the teaching of non-arising that terrifies all the childish, and therefore it is inferior, so it is the notion of inferiority.

original: dman pa de nyid kyis ni smad pa ste /
analyzed: dman pa de nyid kyis ni smad pa ste /
translated: That inferiority itself is contempt.

original: de lta bu'i 'du shes ma skyed cig pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'du shes ma skyed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not generate such a perception.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo ston pa de la ci'i phyir smad par mi bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo ston pa de la ci'i phyir smad par mi bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning: why is it that one should not disparage the teaching of such an essence?

original: de nyid kyi phyir rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is said, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, it is like this:

original: sngags kyi spyod pa ni spyod pa'i mchog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa ni spyod pa'i mchog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the practice of mantra is the supreme practice.‚Äù

original: gang ma skyes par bstan pa 'di ni 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyu yin pas spyod pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: gang ma skyes par bstan pa 'di ni 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyu yin pas spyod pa'i mchog go //
translated: This non-arising that is taught is the cause of enlightenment, and therefore it is the supreme practice.

original: de bas na de ston pas na spyod pa'i mchog ston @37b par byed pas spyod pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: de bas na de ston pas na spyod pa'i mchog ston @37b par byed pas spyod pa'i mchog ste /
translated: Therefore, because it teaches that, it is the teacher of the supreme practice.

original: 'dir ma skyes par bsgom pa la spyod pa'i mchog tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ma skyes par bsgom pa la spyod pa'i mchog tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, non-arising should be seen as the supreme practice.

original: de ji ltar ma skyes pa'i ngo bo ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma skyes pa'i ngo bo ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one realize the essence of non-arising?

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe gsungs so //
translated: The example is stated with ‚Äúit is like this‚Äù and so on.

original: nam mkha' ni thams cad kyi rjes su song ba ste zhes bya ba de yang mi gnas te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni thams cad kyi rjes su song ba ste zhes bya ba de yang mi gnas te /
translated: Space is not located in the aggregates, etc., because it is omnipresent.

original: mkha' la phung po la sogs pa gnas la /
analyzed: mkha' la phung po la sogs pa gnas la /
translated: Space is not located in the aggregates, etc., because it is omnipresent.

original: phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i ngo bo ste de bas na de dang gzhan gyi gzhir gyur pas na kun rdzob tu yang 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i ngo bo ste de bas na de dang gzhan gyi gzhir gyur pas na kun rdzob tu yang 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa med do //
translated: Space is not located in the desire realm, etc., because it is the basis of those, i.e., the aggregates, etc., and because it is the basis of other things.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams la mi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is not located in the desire realm.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams la yang mi gnas te /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams la yang mi gnas te /
translated: It is not located in the elements of earth, water, fire, and air,

original: de rnams ni de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na nam mkha' ni 'di ltar nam mkha' nyid chos thams cad gzhi'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na nam mkha' ni 'di ltar nam mkha' nyid chos thams cad gzhi'i ngo bo'o //
translated: because it is their intrinsic reality. Thus, space is the intrinsic reality of all things.

original: ji ltar nam mkha'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa de bzhin du ma skyes pa'i ngo bo de bzhin nyid kyang rigs lnga'i ngo bo'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu chos thams cad kyang de ltar rjes su
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa de bzhin du ma skyes pa'i ngo bo de bzhin nyid kyang rigs lnga'i ngo bo'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu chos thams cad kyang de ltar rjes su
translated: Just as space is the basis of all phenomena, so also the non-arisen nature, thusness, is the basis of all phenomena that have the nature of the five families.

original: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach this, it says, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, all phenomena should be known in this way.‚Äù

original: don gyi dbang de lta bu mkhyen cing zhes bya ba ni rigs rnam pa lnga po ni nam mkha'i gnas ltar skye ba med par bsgoms pa las byung ba yin no zhes mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi dbang de lta bu mkhyen cing zhes bya ba ni rigs rnam pa lnga po ni nam mkha'i gnas ltar skye ba med par bsgoms pa las byung ba yin no zhes mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowing this kind of power of the meaning‚Äù means knowing that the five families arise from the meditation on the non-arisen space-like nature.üîΩ‚ÄúKnowing the thought‚Äù means knowing that the meditation on the non-arisen space-like nature is suitable for those who have the good fortune to be taught this.

original: bsam pa mkhyen nas zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa nam mkha' lta bu bsgom pa ni skal pa dang ldan par mkhyen nas gang dang gang la zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rigs su snang ba ste /
analyzed: bsam pa mkhyen nas zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa nam mkha' lta bu bsgom pa ni skal pa dang ldan par mkhyen nas gang dang gang la zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rigs su snang ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever appears as the family of hatred, etc.‚Äù

original: gang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rigs kyi skal ba dang ldan pa la zhe sdang gi rigs la sogs pa rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bor nam mkha' ltar ma skyes pa'i sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: gang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rigs kyi skal ba dang ldan pa la zhe sdang gi rigs la sogs pa rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bor nam mkha' ltar ma skyes pa'i sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: For those who are of the same fortune as the family of anger and so on, the yoga of the non-arisenness of the family of anger and so on, which is the nature of Vajrasattva and so on, is taught to be like space.

original: de bas na dman pa'i 'du shes dang smad pa'i 'du shes kyi chos bstan pa 'di la ma byed cig ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dman pa'i 'du shes dang smad pa'i 'du shes kyi chos bstan pa 'di la ma byed cig ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, do not engage in this teaching of the Dharma with the idea of inferiority and the idea of contempt.

original: de dag ni chos bstan pa la byang chub sems dpa' dag de bzhin gshegs pas bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni chos bstan pa la byang chub sems dpa' dag de bzhin gshegs pas bzung ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattvas are taken by the Tathagata into the teaching of the Dharma.

original: ji ltar the tshom bsal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar the tshom bsal bar bya zhe na /
translated: How is doubt to be removed?

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar nam mkha' la tshig nges pa brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig de dag rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩrigs lnga'i ngo bo'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni nam mkha' @38a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar nam mkha' la tshig nges pa brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig de dag rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te / rigs lnga'i ngo bo'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni nam mkha' @38a * //
translated: Son of noble family, in that way, the commitments of the Tathagata should be understood through the expression of words in space.

original: dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The commitments of all the Tathagatas, who are the nature of the five families, should be seen as being like space.

original: chos thams cad don dam par gdod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par gdod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are ultimately unborn from the beginning.

original: 'o na ji ltar sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'byung ba so sor snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'byung ba so sor snang bar 'gyur /
translated: Well then, how can the appearance of the individual manifestations of the vajra body and so forth occur?

original: gal te don dam par na thams cad skye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: gal te don dam par na thams cad skye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: If ultimately everything is of the nature of non-arising,

original: de bas na 'khrul pa tsam du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul pa tsam du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then in order to teach that it is mere delusion,

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe gsungs pa ste /
translated: the example of the son of a barren woman and so forth is stated, beginning with ‚ÄúSon of the family, it is like this‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu skye ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu skye ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: [The son of a barren woman] is posited as arising conventionally,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy going and coming, and so forth‚Äù means without arising and ceasing,

original: thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything is essenceless.

original: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid ces pa ni don dam pa yang yin la de kho na nyid kyang yin pa ste chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid ces pa ni don dam pa yang yin la de kho na nyid kyang yin pa ste chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: The ultimate thatness is both ultimate and thatness, the beginningless and endless dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de nyid dam tshig ste /
analyzed: de nyid dam tshig ste /
translated: That itself is the commitment.

original: de skad ces bya ba'i ming gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i ming gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who has that name is so-called.

original: le'u dgu pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u dgu pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary to the ninth chapter.

original: // / rdo rje phra mo la sogs pa bsgom pa rdzogs nas zla ba drug brtul zhugs yang dag par spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhag bdun gyi bar du snying pos kun du bskul zhing rnal 'byor bsgoms la dkyil 'khor bri ste /
analyzed: // / rdo rje phra mo la sogs pa bsgom pa rdzogs nas zla ba drug brtul zhugs yang dag par spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhag bdun gyi bar du snying pos kun du bskul zhing rnal 'byor bsgoms la dkyil 'khor bri ste /
translated: Having completed the meditation on the vajra-particle, etc., the yogi who is practicing the conduct of observances for six months should, for seven days, invoke with the essence, meditate on the yoga, and draw the mandala.

original: sgrub pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs yang dag par bskul ba'i le'u gsungs so //
analyzed: sgrub pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs yang dag par bskul ba'i le'u gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach that one should enter into the practice, the chapter on the invocation of the minds of all the tathagatas is taught.

original: dam tshig chen po rdo rje zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po rdo rje zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The great commitment vajra is Vajrasattva, the nature of the dharmadhatu without beginning or end.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i rgyun dang ldan pa'i kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i rgyun dang ldan pa'i kun du bzang po'o //
translated: His reality is Samantabhadra, who is endowed with the stream of uncontaminated bliss and mental satisfaction.

original: de'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni de nyid mngon sum du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni de nyid mngon sum du byas pa ste /
translated: His manifest, perfect enlightenment is the direct realization of thatness.

original: de nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is the secret of his body, speech, and mind is called that.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to that Tathagata who has such a nature.

original: de nyid sngags snying kun bsdus pa //
analyzed: de nyid sngags snying kun bsdus pa //
translated: That is the compendium of all the essence mantras.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: The nature of the entity which is the nature of body, speech, and mind is thatness.

original: de nyid sngags kyi snying po kun bsdus pa ste de kho na nyid bsgoms pas sngags thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mi g-yeng bar bsgrags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid sngags kyi snying po kun bsdus pa ste de kho na nyid bsgoms pas sngags thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mi g-yeng bar bsgrags zhes bya'o //
translated: That is the compendium of all the essence mantras. By meditating on thatness, all the mantras are accomplished. Therefore, that is called the undistracted proclamation of his body, speech, and mind.

original: dngos grub chen po ni rigs lnga'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: dngos grub chen po ni rigs lnga'i dngos grub bo //
translated: The great powers are the powers of the five clans.

original: de'i @38b tshul ni bsgom pa nyid de bas na phul du byung ba'i dngos po bas na mchog go //
analyzed: de'i @38b tshul ni bsgom pa nyid de bas na phul du byung ba'i dngos po bas na mchog go //
translated: The method of that is meditation. Therefore, it is supreme, since it is the best of all things.

original: nyon mongs kun gyi rgya mtsho gtso //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun gyi rgya mtsho gtso //
translated: The chief of the ocean of all afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba la 'khor ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'khor ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rgya mtsho'o //
translated: Here, samsara is the ocean of all afflictions.

original: der bdag por gyur pas na gtso bo nyid de //
analyzed: der bdag por gyur pas na gtso bo nyid de //
translated: Since it is the lord of that, it is the chief.

original: sems can thams cad rjes su ston pa por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rjes su ston pa por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the one who guides all sentient beings.

original: de kho na nyid kyi sngags kyi snying po kun bsdus pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi sngags kyi snying po kun bsdus pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The essence of the mantra of reality is stated as the collection:

original: lus dang ngag dang yid rnams ni //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid rnams ni //
translated: Body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: And so forth.

original: bsgom zhes bya ba ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom zhes bya ba ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: How is it meditated?

original: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ste rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ste rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is stated as nonconceptual, free from conceptuality.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it nonconceptual?

original: mi dmigs pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes pa'o //
translated: It is stated as nonapprehending.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩgang na'ang mi gnas mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir // gang na'ang mi gnas mnyam pa nyid //
translated: In order to teach nonapprehending,

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: It is stated as nonabiding, equality.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na gang na yang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na gang na yang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from the conceptualization of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, and the apprehended and apprehender, it does not abide anywhere.

original: de ltar bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ni sems can gyi don la nus pa yin te /

translated: When reading the holy Dharma, one should do the pride of Loke≈õvara from the syllable ƒÅ·∏•.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad @76b kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs lnga'i lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje ste de dag ni snying po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad @76b kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs lnga'i lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje ste de dag ni snying po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe body, speech, and mind of all vajra holders‚Äù and so on. The body, speech, and mind of the deities of the five families are the vajra, and they are the essence.

original: rdo rje ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: Vajra is reality.

original: de nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid rnam par dgongs nas cang mi gsung par gyur to zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes gdul bya rnams la bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid rnam par dgongs nas cang mi gsung par gyur to zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes gdul bya rnams la bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Having contemplated the sameness of that, he became silent. This is in order to teach disciples that the nature of all phenomena is essenceless.

original: don de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is stated by the Tathagatas as ‚Äúthe non-apprehension of the nature of vajra body, speech, and mind.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gsung rdo rje'i tshig la phyin ci log kun 'byung bas mi brtag tu gsol zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa ston pa'i gsung de ni yang dag pa ma yin pas yongs su brtag pa las byung
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gsung rdo rje'i tshig la phyin ci log kun 'byung bas mi brtag tu gsol zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa ston pa'i gsung de ni yang dag pa ma yin pas yongs su brtag pa las byung
translated: The Bhagavat, all Tathagatas, please do not consider the vajra speech of the Tathagatas to be the origin of error. This is because the speech that teaches vajra body and so forth is not real, but arises from imagination.

original: ba ste / de don dam par na yod pa ma yin no zhes de la 'di ltar yongs su rtog par ma mdzad cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: ba ste / de don dam par na yod pa ma yin no zhes de la 'di ltar yongs su rtog par ma mdzad cig ces pa'o //
translated: Do not imagine that it exists ultimately.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir gsung yang dag pa ma yin pas yongs su rtog pa las byung ba zhes de ltar brtag par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir gsung yang dag pa ma yin pas yongs su rtog pa las byung ba zhes de ltar brtag par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one not imagine that the speech is not real, but arises from imagination?

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because of the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid ni rdo rje'i dbyings te de dag gi ngo bo nyid spyod par ni sems can thams cad kyi don du gzugs thams cad ston pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid ni rdo rje'i dbyings te de dag gi ngo bo nyid spyod par ni sems can thams cad kyi don du gzugs thams cad ston pa yin la /
translated: the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is the vajra realm, and the nature of that is the display for the sake of all sentient beings, the manifestation of all forms.

original: de dag tu 'gro zhing rjes su 'gro ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag tu 'gro zhing rjes su 'gro ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po 'di lta ste /

original: 'gro zhing zhes pa ni dang por yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du mdzad pa thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro zhing zhes pa ni dang por yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du mdzad pa thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: Going is the realization of the first manifestation of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni gong nas gong du sbyor ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //üîΩ'di skad ston par 'gyur te gang gi phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs thams cad ston par spyod pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni gong nas gong du sbyor ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o // 'di skad ston par 'gyur te gang gi phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs thams cad ston par spyod pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung
translated: The following is the ability to apply to higher and higher [realms].

original: dang thugs bdag med pa'i gsang ba'i yi ge thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis ston par spyod do //
analyzed: dang thugs bdag med pa'i gsang ba'i yi ge thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis ston par spyod do //
translated: This is what is taught: because this Great Vajradhara is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas, he displays all forms. Therefore, he displays the secret syllables of the selflessness of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas by the power of the perfection of means.

original: de'i phyir gsung yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'o zhes ma gsung shig ces so gal te de skad smras na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsung yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'o zhes ma gsung shig ces so gal te de skad smras na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: Therefore, do not say that speech arises from unreal imagination. If one were to say that, what would be the fault?

original: gang gi phyir tshangs pa la sogs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po la brnyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshangs pa la sogs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po la brnyas par 'gyur te /
translated: Because Brahma and so forth would despise Great Vajradhara.

original: log par yongs su rtog pa las byung ba'am /üîΩlog pa'i ngo bo yin la sku dang gsung @77a * //
analyzed: log par yongs su rtog pa las byung ba'am / log pa'i ngo bo yin la sku dang gsung @77a * //
translated: or arisen from wrong thorough reflection,

original: dang thugs bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gsang ba'i yi ge ston par mi spyod do //
analyzed: dang thugs bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gsang ba'i yi ge ston par mi spyod do //
translated: or having a wrong nature, but not to teach the secret syllables which are the characteristics of the body, speech, and mind of the selflessness.

original: de bas na ston par spyod pa'i nus pa ma shes nas gsang ba'i yi ge 'di tshig des de ltar ston pa yin no zhes de ltar brnyas par 'gyur te de'i phyir dngos po rnams ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na ston par spyod pa'i nus pa ma shes nas gsang ba'i yi ge 'di tshig des de ltar ston pa yin no zhes de ltar brnyas par 'gyur te de'i phyir dngos po rnams ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, not knowing the power of teaching, they will despise the secret syllables, thinking, ‚ÄúThat is taught by that word in that way.‚Äù Thus, things are delightful when not examined.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason, he says, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gang gi phyir de nyid mi gsungs zhes pa'i rgyu gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gi phyir de nyid mi gsungs zhes pa'i rgyu gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The reason is stated: ‚ÄúWhy is that reality not taught?‚Äù The cause is stated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyed rnams lta ci smos te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi phyogs 'jog par bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyed rnams lta ci smos te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi phyogs 'jog par bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat need is there to speak of you bodhisattvas?‚Äù and so on teaches the position of the tathƒÅgatas themselves.

original: 'di dag ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te gang gi phyir tshangs pa la sogs pa 'di ltar sems bskyed mod kyi 'on kyang kho bo cag ni chos nyid ji ltar gnas pa de ltar ston gyi bstan par bya bas 'jig rten rnams slu bar ni mi byed
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te gang gi phyir tshangs pa la sogs pa 'di ltar sems bskyed mod kyi 'on kyang kho bo cag ni chos nyid ji ltar gnas pa de ltar ston gyi bstan par bya bas 'jig rten rnams slu bar ni mi byed
translated: This is what is being taught: although Brahma and so forth have generated this kind of mind, nevertheless, we teach in accordance with the way things abide, the way they are, and do not deceive the world with what is to be taught.

original: do // gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis byang chub mngon du byas la de ni kho bo cag gi rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin na byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po lta smos kyang ci dgos te rtog pa thams cad dang bralüîΩba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: do // gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis byang chub mngon du byas la de ni kho bo cag gi rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin na byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po lta smos kyang ci dgos te rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Since we have actualized enlightenment, and since it is not the domain of our conceptual thoughts, what need is there to mention the essence of enlightenment, Great Vajradhara, who is free from all conceptual thought?

original: bstan pa ji ltar nus par 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan pa ji ltar nus par 'gyur //
translated: How could it be taught?

original: de'i phyir tshangs pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di lta bu'i sems bskyed par 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang de dag gi sa bon bskyed pa'i phyir gsung yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i phyin ci log kun 'byung ba chos bstanüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshangs pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di lta bu'i sems bskyed par 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang de dag gi sa bon bskyed pa'i phyir gsung yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i phyin ci log kun 'byung ba chos bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although Brahma and so on generate such a thought toward the Lord, nevertheless, in order to plant the seed of that thought in them, he teaches the origin of the origin of the false imagination, which is the origin of the origin of the false view.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir khyed kyis byang chub 'di mi shes zhes gtan tshigs gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir khyed kyis byang chub 'di mi shes zhes gtan tshigs gsungs pa'o //
translated: Why is that? He states the reason: ‚ÄúBecause you do not know this enlightenment.‚Äù

original: skye ba med pa'i rdo rje mngon par byang chub pa ni ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa bsgoms pas rdzogs pa ni ngo bo nyid med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rdo rje mngon par byang chub pa ni ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa bsgoms pas rdzogs pa ni ngo bo nyid med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The vajra-like clear realization of non-arising arises from the unchanging essence, meaning that the completion of meditation on selflessness arises from the unchanging essence.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i byang chub byung ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i byang chub byung ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Therefore, the occurrence of enlightenment, which is free from all conceptuality, through meditation on the meaning of reality, is the essence of the individual intuitive awareness of yogins.

original: gang gi phyir tshul 'di nyid kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa'ang 'dir skye ba med pa yin la gang yang sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i chos nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tshul de ni sems can thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshul 'di nyid kyis sku rdo rje la sogs pa'ang 'dir skye ba med pa yin la gang yang sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i chos nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tshul de ni sems can thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin
translated: For this very reason, the vajra body and so forth are also unproduced here. And whatever is the reality of the vajra body and so forth, the nature of non-entityness, is also the nature of all sentient beings.

original: no zhes pa'i don to //üîΩdes na sems can thams cad byang chub thob pa yin la rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid du brtags pas smra bar byed pa smra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo rang bzhin gyis dag
analyzed: no zhes pa'i don to // des na sems can thams cad byang chub thob pa yin la rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid du brtags pas smra bar byed pa smra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo rang bzhin gyis dag
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩTherefore, all sentient beings have attained enlightenment. And because the nature of pure phenomena is imagined, it is said that the one who speaks does not speak.

original: pa'i chos nyid yin la /
analyzed: pa'i chos nyid yin la /
translated: All phenomena are the essence of suchness, the nature of pure phenomena.

original: de nyid kyi rang bzhin @77b can gyi rang gi ngo bor rtog pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid du brtags pa ste don dam par skye ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rang bzhin @77b can gyi rang gi ngo bor rtog pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid du brtags pa ste don dam par skye ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is imagined to be the nature of that, the nature of its own entity, is imagined to be the identity of the pure Dharma, which means that it is ultimately unborn.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩchos kyi dbyings na gnas med par //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / chos kyi dbyings na gnas med par //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: in the realm of phenomena, there is no abode.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid de de nyid gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid de de nyid gnas med pa'o //
translated: The realm of phenomena is suchness, and that itself is without abode.

original: de la rtog pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de la rtog pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Imagination is the nature of the entity of the pure Dharma.

original: rdo rje las byung zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje las byung zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid las byung ba ste /
translated: Arisen from the vajra means arisen from suchness.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' las dngos po thams cad 'byung ba ltar de bzhin du de bzhin nyid las rtog pa rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' las dngos po thams cad 'byung ba ltar de bzhin du de bzhin nyid las rtog pa rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: Just as all things arise from space, in the same way, imaginations arise from suchness.

original: smra bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: smra bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Spoken means that they will arise conventionally.

original: / smra ba ma yin zhes pa ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: / smra ba ma yin zhes pa ni don dam par ro //
translated: Unspoken means ultimately.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar yang dag par 'jug ces bya ba ni gang nas skye ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar yang dag par 'jug ces bya ba ni gang nas skye ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, How does one enter? meaning from where does one arise.

original: mkha' dbyings rdo rje'i dbus gnas par //
analyzed: mkha' dbyings rdo rje'i dbus gnas par //
translated: Abiding in the middle of the vajra expanse of space,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa bsgoms pas mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas brtul zhugs yang dag par spyad pas nyin zhag bdun rnal 'byor 'di bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa bsgoms pas mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas brtul zhugs yang dag par spyad pas nyin zhag bdun rnal 'byor 'di bsgom par bya ste /
translated: A practitioner who has attained the signs by meditating on Vajra Body and so forth should cultivate this yoga for seven days by perfectly practicing the conduct.

original: nam mkha' la rnam bar snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sbyor bas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la de gnas lngar rang gi lha'i gzugs kyis bzhag la bdag nyid kyi spyi bor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku yang zhugs par bsams la spyan
analyzed: nam mkha' la rnam bar snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sbyor bas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la de gnas lngar rang gi lha'i gzugs kyis bzhag la bdag nyid kyi spyi bor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku yang zhugs par bsams la spyan
translated: In the sky, through the yoga of Vairochana and so forth, one should visualize the mandala of Vairochana and so forth, abiding in the five places with one's own deity form, and imagine the form of Vairochana and so forth entering one's crown.

original: la sogs pa rang gi rigs kyi yum rnams kyis kyang bdud rtsi'i chus bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: la sogs pa rang gi rigs kyi yum rnams kyis kyang bdud rtsi'i chus bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar gyur par bsam mo //
translated: One should also imagine that one is empowered by one's own lineage mothers such as Lochana and so forth with the water of nectar.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dam tshig ni //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dam tshig ni //
translated: The commitments of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i don du brtag / cho ga bzhin du kun bsgoms na //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i don du brtag / cho ga bzhin du kun bsgoms na //
translated: If one meditates on all in accordance with the rite,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sku'i dam tshig ni sku'i rdo rje'o //

original: gsung gi dam tshig ni gsung gi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gsung gi dam tshig ni gsung gi rdo rje'o //
translated: The pledge of speech is the vajra of speech.üîΩThe pledge of mind is the vajra of mind.

original: thugs kyi dam tshig ni thugs kyi rdo rje ste rang nyid kyi sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i spyor bar bdag nyid kyi gzugs rnam par bsgoms pa las bskyed cing spro ba dang bsdu ba dang gnas pa dang brtan par bya ba rnams bsgoms pa las sku rdo
analyzed: thugs kyi dam tshig ni thugs kyi rdo rje ste rang nyid kyi sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i spyor bar bdag nyid kyi gzugs rnam par bsgoms pa las bskyed cing spro ba dang bsdu ba dang gnas pa dang brtan par bya ba rnams bsgoms pa las sku rdo
translated: One should imagine one‚Äôs own form generated from the meditation on the creation and emanation, gathering and abiding, and stabilization of one‚Äôs own body vajra and so on.

original: rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen por brtag par rang gi rgyud byas pa'i bsgom par bya ba ni rigs thams cad kyi bsgom pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen por brtag par rang gi rgyud byas pa'i bsgom par bya ba ni rigs thams cad kyi bsgom pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the great seal of the body vajra and so on is said to be the meditation of all the clans.

original: lag pa'i phyag rgya mi bcing ngo //
analyzed: lag pa'i phyag rgya mi bcing ngo //
translated: One should not bind the hand seal.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de bzhin nyid la bsam pa shin tu nges pa'i sdom pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de bzhin nyid la bsam pa shin tu nges pa'i sdom pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the vow of the yogin who is very certain about the contemplation of suchness.

original: de yang dngos po thams cad rnam par rtog pa las byung par bsams la /
analyzed: de yang dngos po thams cad rnam par rtog pa las byung par bsams la /
translated: Moreover, one should consider that all things arise from thought.

original: sems tsam gyis 'di dag thams cad rdzogs par byed @78a * //
analyzed: sems tsam gyis 'di dag thams cad rdzogs par byed @78a * //
translated: One should think, By mind alone all of this is accomplished.

original: do ; / sangs rgyas dam tshig ces bya ba ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: do ; / sangs rgyas dam tshig ces bya ba ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The pledge of the Buddha is the vajra-yoga of body, speech, and mind.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi dam tshig gis //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi dam tshig gis //
translated: By the pledge of the three vajras,

original: mgu zhing tshim pa dag tu bya //
analyzed: mgu zhing tshim pa dag tu bya //
translated: one should be satisfied and delighted.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi khams thams cad zhe sdang gi rigs kyi ngo bor bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi khams thams cad zhe sdang gi rigs kyi ngo bor bsam par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner of the family of anger should consider the entire realm of sentient beings to be of the nature of the family of anger.
